name: Hilton Virginia Beach Oceanfront

reviews.text: In general the stay was fine and the location was excellent but not worth the ~$200/night. The employees were polite but I had several problems during my stay.
reviews.title: Poor service, good location

reviews.text: I called a day in advance to see if we could get an early check in (we were arriving at noon). We called when we arrived at the airport and they said maybe we could get in at 2pm, then it was 3pm, then maybe by 4pm (the guaranteed checkin time). At 4pm my room was still not ready! I checked in at 6pm and got my key only to find staff hanging out in my room (still cleaning??) when I got to it. So I had to wait some more. It was really disappointing.
reviews.title: Don't believe the negative reviews

reviews.text: We had problems getting our keys to work consistently in the doors, the margaritas at the pool bar were terrible (they intentionally added water to them), and the hotel staff threw away some of my toilettries thinking my room was no longer occupied. Also the concierge tried to give us some time share presentation that we were clearly not interested in (especially after all the problems).
reviews.title: Birthday Gone Bad 4 hours NO FOOD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were other nice hotels nearby, I would recommend trying one of those. FYI.There are fighter jets that fly over constantly and they are quite loud.
reviews.title: Very disappointed with hotel

reviews.text: I was a little scared about staying at the hotel after reading the reviews but was pleasantly surprised. The staff was great, there was always available beach towels, even complementary sand chairs everyday. The rooms were fine, one of our rooms had some toilet troubles, they were there within 5 minutes and fixed the problem quickly. One of the televisions wasn't working when we checked in, again someone was there within minutes to fix it. There was never a problem with housekeeping, quite the opposite, they left extra towels in both rooms, cleaned them in a timely fashion, and even offered us extras the morning we were checking out. And there is no way someone can complain about that pool on the roof. I would say the only valid complaint I have read here would be the cost for internet service, that just seems silly given the price of the hotel... but it was easy enough to go across the street to Starbucks for wireless. We didn't try the restaurants so can't speak to that. Just don't want everyone to believe what has been said here because it was far from our experience. Bottom line is if you don't want to pay these prices, you're better off going somewhere else anyway...
reviews.title: After 3 years staying here, this hotel is noticablly slipping.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, we arrived for check-in around 4pm and was told the room would not be ready for another hour or so. We finally made it to our room at 5:30. At first sight the room was ok at best. The bed was extremely uncomfortable, too soft,and sunk in the middle The shower door would not close properly and allowed large amounts of water to leak onto the floor. We had to use lots of towels. The air conditioning unit was loud and on the third night started a weird beeping sound at 5am! A call to the front was not returned until 7am. Tired and sleepy, we ordered room service for breakfast. The meal arrived cold, the waiter did not bring any condiments, and also forgot to bring the toast. He later returned with condiments and still forgot the toast. With no microwave in the room, we wound up paying $50+ for a cold breakfast. Maid service was consistently poor. They even had to be asked to dump the trash!! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Looks are definitely deceiving in this case. Never again!
reviews.title: Not worth the money, horrible service and amenities

reviews.text: We arrived Sunday, July 26th, at 6:15pm. We were told our room was not ready and to check back in an hour. The delay was attributed to a problem with linen. We were told to go to the restaurant for a drink or to sit outside. We were not offered a complementary drink or meal for the inconvenience. We were using the valet service for parking and were told we could not unload our luggage for storage until our room was ready do to how busy they were. The car was moved. When we were able to check in an hour later, the car had to be returned to the front of the hotel to get our luggage and check in.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, expected better service for the price

reviews.text: On 6/27 we used room service for dinner. Our dirty plates were not removed from our room for two days. When they were removed, they sat in the hall outside our room for another two days. Housekeeping was inconsistent. Clearly there was a linen problem. The dirty towels and washcloths were removed but too little clean linen was left. This required calls to housekeeping for towels. Housekeeping was very late a couple days. The key cards are a problem. We had to get two new key cards twice during the stay. We were told to stop keeping the key cards close to cell phones. Neither one of us kept our key cards any where near our mobile phones. There are no exhaust fans in the bathrooms in a very hot, humid place!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with apathetic, ambivalent managerial staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a pet friendly hotel. I am a dog lover but do not comprehend taking a dog on a vacation and leaving him in a hotel all day to bark. One night at 11:30pm, I had to call to get someone to talk to the people in a room two doors down about their barking dogs on a balcony.
reviews.title: Average and disappointing, will not stay there again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Internet service is $10.45 per 24hours. That is totally absurd. If they really need to charge for internet (a new way to make money since most have cell phones and do not use the hotel phones), they would probably make more by charging less per day. That way, I would have probably paid for service more than one day. Other days, I took my lap top out and walked up the board walk until I picked up a hot spot.
reviews.title: Not Worth The $$$!

reviews.text: The Hilton has the best location and is one of the nicest hotels in Virginia Beach. It is very expensive, $300-400 per night so one expects luxury when paying those prices. It is worth springing for the oceanview rooms and they have nice balconies to sit out and watch the jets, beach, concerts, etc. We stayed on the concert side, north side, and that was great for our needs. The beds are plush with lots of pillows, the towels are large and soft, and we found the housekeeping very good and done in a timely manner. The staff was friendly and accomodating. We requested 2 rooms next door to eachother and at first were not able to get that but the front desk took our phone numbers and told us if we were willing to wait a few hours, they could do that for us. We had 2 teenage girls that would be hopping back and forth so it was important to us to be next door so we waited, ate, did a bit of strolling on the boardwalk, and the staff called us when the rooms were ready. The hotel amenities are basic for the price and not very exciting. There are no refrigerators or microwaves in the rooms and all of the restaurants in the area seem to serve large portions but taking leftovers is not possible since there is no place to store anythng of that nature. That was disappointing since a few hotels close by do have those ammenities for close to the same price.
reviews.title: Best location. Wish it offered a bit more.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel restaurant, Catch 31, is a great restaurant and the service is very good. The hotel has nice rockers outdoors for relaxing, talking, and viewing the beach and boardwalk. At night, the fireplaces add a nice touch for relaxing and talking. The roof top pool and lounge are awesome. It does get crowded, but it is a roof top pool, so space is limited but the view is wonderful. Towel service is provided on the roof also.
reviews.title: Good, but not GREAT!

reviews.text: Despite the fact that you pay $400 for a room, Hilton insists on charging you $10 per day for internet service. If you walk across the street to Starbucks and spend $4 on coffee, you can sit there and surf the web for free on their network. The Hilton does provide a free boarding pass service so go to the business center and take advantage of advance airline check in and boarding pass printing. You can also surf the web for a fee in the business center. A few minutes cost about $5.00. Parking is provided in a garage across the street for free with a room key. Also, if friends visit you, they can use the valet service for free....tipping only.
reviews.title: Great Vacation at the Beach!

reviews.text: The hotel gives a $5.00 discount on beach lounge rentals but we did end up paying $54.00 for a one day rental for cushioned lounges and umbrella. That seems to be the going rate for all rentals on the beach which does add up if you rent them for a few days. They do provide nice wind covers for those with little babies who want them out of the sun and wind. We went to the beach 3 times and the lounges were supposed to be available until 6:30pm but they ALWAYS came by and said they were "closing early today" and wanted us off the lounges between 5:30 and 6pm. The guys at the activities desk said that was not supposed to happen but there was little they could do about it.
reviews.title: A Days Inn at Ritz Carlton Prices

reviews.text: Definately, take advantage of the VB bus service. For $2.00 a day, you can have unlimited hop on/hop off service and can change buses to go and from the the mall and/or the aquarium. So, park your car and let them do the driving around town so you can enjoy looking around.
reviews.title: July 4th - Great view, amazing fireworks, uneven service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel shows every sign of being either badly managed or not managed at all. Individual staff can be good but the overall service level is poor. Reception is staffed by half-trained, fairly pleasant young girls who have difficulty navigating their own computer system. Housekeeping seems to be another area - our room became available to us at 6 30pm - establishing a new record for us. Two cleaning staff offered completely unasked for complaints about their workload. And finally, to the restaurants where queues exist even at breakfast when empty tables awaited clearing.
reviews.title: Badly managed hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a shame because the hotel is well situated on the ocean front, fairly new with good size, well kept rooms (despite the cleaners' workloads).
reviews.title: So glad the negative reviews didn't sway us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't take to the overloud musak piped everywhere except to lifts and rooms but that's individual taste and we deeply disliked the kids next door slamming doors until we stopped it at 1 30am but that's not the hotel's fault.
reviews.title: Awful!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Maybe we were just unlucky but if anybody from Hilton Hotels reads this, I really would review the management you have in place.
reviews.title: Wonderful place! Loved it!

reviews.text: First, I will say that I read many reviews about this hotel, and despite most of them being negative, I still went with the Hilton. We spent a four day weekend at the hotel and really loved every minute of it - so much that we'll probably go back around the same time next year. To start, we arrived early and had no problem getting an early check-in (and later on, a late check-out). We had a corner oceanfront room that was just fabulous. It was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the doors opening up to the balcony gave us a great view of the beach and the boardwalk. Since it was cool enough to do so - we let the doors open at night so that we could listen to the waves crashing on the beach.
reviews.title: Great spot on the beach!

aka: Hilton Virginia Beach Oceanfront Hotel Virginia Beach
description: Discover the perfect beach destination for your vacation getaway - where you can unwind in luxurious accommodations, dine at oceanfront restaurants, listen to a live concert in the park or relax in a cabana on the beach.Situated on the city’s famed boardwalk adjacent to Neptune’s Park, the Hilton Virginia Beach Oceanfront features a collection of 289 upscale guest rooms and spacious suites. Our exclusive Empyrean Club, located on the top three floors, features personalized concierge service, complimentary breakfast in a private lounge, private key card access and refined amenities.Though Virginia Beach boasts a number of exciting activities and attractions, our luxury hotel is a landmark in its own right. With two award-winning restaurants onsite, Catch 31 and Salacia, you won’t have to go far for fresh fish or the only 4-Diamond steakhouse in Virginia. Our resort is also home to Sky Bar, serving creative cocktails with panoramic views 21 stories above the beach.The Hilton Virginia Beach Oceanfront is also the ultimate destination for meetings and weddings, with over 12,000 square feet of flexible event space. Other onsite amenities include our 24-hour business center, our inspiring fitness center and Virginia’s first rooftop infinity pool overlooking the Atlantic.
